answers.answer: I had this issue with my last pregnancy.  He hame our fine, free of defects.  I am measuring 2 weeks larger with this one based on the due date from three individual early untrasounds.  I will be scheduling a level two on monday for sometime next week to make sure I do not have the same issue this time around.  I am only 31 weeks along.  With my other child I had to do weekly BPPs, bio-physical profiles, and NSTs, non-stress tests, up until the last month.  Then they went biweekly.  If there are any concerns they will moniter you frequently and may suggest and induction.  I was induces at 38 weeks with my last.

My cousin had the same issue...but her's was higher.  She ended up having a c-section at 39 wks.  They attempted a natural delivery..but the baby was face up and got stuck....havign nothing to do with the fluid issues.  They eventually did an emergency c-section...be thankful that you know about your c-section is scheduled....you have time to prepare mentally.  Other than the issues with labor....the baby was absolutely fine.  Completely healthy. Big and beautiful!

question: I'm very worried.  I went to the Dr today and had and u/s to determine the size of the baby.  I'm scheduled for c-section on the 28th.  This was just a regular weekly check up.  Then they said I had to much fluid and had to sit on the monitor for 20 minutes.  During that time... they said my level was 21.8 your not suppose to be over 20, they said I was contracting quite a bit, and my cervix is very thin but not dialating yet.  They said it can be nothing or can be caused by birth defects etc.  However, all of my tests have come back fine but the diabetes.  I failed the 1 hour, but passed the 3 hour test.  Anyone else with this issue and what was your out come.  Should I be concerned or is everything okay!
title: Worried 36 weeks and to much amnio fluid
